content.description: Start on the same hold as Maelstrom: the good hold on the rightmost edge of the jutting shelf. From there, go up and slightly to the right. Top out by traversing the horizontal crag on the right after the second shelf.Crux: first few moves before the second shelfGood: Some interesting grips and motions involved.Bad: Topping out directly is dangerous; it is better to shuffle left along the horizontal crag after the second shelf.
content.location: Starts on the big shelf on the north side close to the bridge.

content.description: Start on the left side with your hands on the arete. Work your hands and feed straight up; face holds are on. Topping out is just slightly difficult; if you're concerned, you should get someone to spot you.Crux: getting past the main horizontal crack.Good: Fun, balancey moves. The arrete is wonderfully shaped.Bad:This route isn't particularly strenuous and has more to do with technique.
content.location: A few meters east of the downclimb on the north side. It is the most obvious arete.

content.description:
Start on good holds low with feet on thin rail near the ground. Jump for the obvious pocket and make your way to the top. Face climbing only. Right arÃªte and left crack are off.  

  I'd bet someone has already climbed this. However I'm not a local and didn't see it in the route list. It was super fun but dirty like it hasn't seen any traffic. It's adjacent to other established climbs, so I though worthy to add to the list.  

  Please, a local should confirm the route, grade, and FA.
Simple warmup for the area with the crux at the top out. Good top out practice. Bad; tops out into some bushes.
content.location: To the right of vortex, in the crack to the left of vertical sloth

climbs.name: Maelstrom
climbs.fa: First Recorded Ascent (FRA): Martin Loncaric (29. Jul. 2013)

content.description: On the edge of the first jutting shelf about 4 feet off the ground there is a nice hold where you start. Traverse left along the shelf until you can mantle on top of it (about where the dirt mound is). The dirt mound is off. After you get on top of the first shelf you can top out following the crag to the right.Crux: continuously until you get on top of the first shelfGood: It's a unique route with lots of arm strength, balance, and technique involved.Bad: Topping out directly seems to be unsafe - once you get on top of the second shelf it is easiest/safest/wisest to shuffle along the crack that goes horizontally to the right and top out at the next crack.
content.protection: Use a crash pad. Optimally have someone move it as you go from right to left and then back to right.
content.location: On the north side near the bridge.

content.description: Start on the crack on its left side. Climb up to the horizontal seam, then follow it to the right and top out.Crux: Horizontal portionGood: Very unique curves of the rock and motions to climb them. The coolness factor alone is reason to climb it.Bad: Doesn't require that much creativity.
content.protection: Crash mat, and someone to move it for you.
content.location: Just to the right of Vertical Sloth (a few meters east of the down climb on the north side). It's the overhanging rock with the grafiti on it.

content.description:
This is exclusively a bouldering spot. The rock quality is quite good (rough but not pointy) for the climbs listed here, although some others to the west are covered in dirt and low quality. 

  The area is mostly sunny and not very windy. Sometimes after a good rain the previous day, a stream will flow through the arroyo which makes some (but not all) of the routes inaccessible.
